docs.snippet: HAVANA, Nov. 29 -- C.H. Bhabha, delegation chief for India, warned the United Nations Trade and Employment Conference today that the "considerable misgivings" of undeveloped countries toward the draft charter of the proposed International Trade...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Nov. 29 -- C.H. Bhabha, delegation chief for India, warned the United Nations Trade and Employment Conference today that the "considerable misgivings" of undeveloped countries toward the draft charter of the proposed International Trade Organization were "genuine and cannot be disregarded."

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly approved yesterday proposal to partition Palestine into two states, one Arab and the other Jewish, that are to become fully independent by Oct. 1. The vote was 33 to 13 with ten abstentions and one delegation, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly approved yesterday proposal to partition Palestine into two states, one Arab and the other Jewish, that are to become fully independent by Oct. 1. The vote was 33 to 13 with ten abstentions and one delegation, the Siamese, absent.

docs.snippet: The Canadian free dollar dominated trading in the foreign exchange market last week, as it slipped to 88.50 cents, lowest since December, 1943. Pound sterling presented a firm undertone, fractional gains featuring the spot and "forward" positions....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian free dollar dominated trading in the foreign exchange market last week, as it slipped to 88.50 cents, lowest since December, 1943. Pound sterling presented a firm undertone, fractional gains featuring the spot and "forward" positions. Swiss free francs also showed a modest gain. Minor size variations also occurred in the Belgian, Argentine and Peruvian documents.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Dec. 1 -- The announcement that Britain had sold u48,000,000 worth of gold during November and in addition bought $60,000,000 from the International Monetary Fund checked a rally in gilt-edged stocks in the stock markets here today.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Dec. 1 -- The announcement that Britain had sold u48,000,000 worth of gold during November and in addition bought $60,000,000 from the International Monetary Fund checked a rally in gilt-edged stocks in the stock markets here today.

docs.snippet: THE first real post-war cruise season, however limited by tonnage shortages, has opened, and there is some evidence that the rush-for-space theme may have been sung too often and with too much conviction.
